intro: Hexalobus tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly hexalobus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Hexalobus tomentosus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along stream banks.
